column1: '''Edoras''' was the capital of [[Rohan]] that held the Golden Hall of [[Meduseld]].
Rohan's first capital was at [[Aldburg]] in the [[Folde]], until [[Rulers of Rohan
column2: King]] [[Eorl]] the Young or his son [[Brego]] built Edoras.

column1: [[Wulf]] son of [[Freca]] the Dunlending, invaded Rohan in {{TA
column2: 2758}} and took Edoras usurping the throne in [[Meduseld]].  But the [[Long Winter]], which had lasted five long months, ended and [[Fréaláf]] son of [[Hild]] came out of [[Dunharrow]] and with a small band of men, surprising Wulf, he attacked '''Edoras''' and slew Wulf, regaining the city.

column1: It was here that [[Aragorn]], [[Gimli]], [[Legolas]], and [[Gandalf]] the White met with [[Théoden]].

The city was built on a hill in [[Harrowdale]], a valley of the [[White Mountains]] which lay under the great mountain [[Starkhorn]]. The river [[Snowbourn]] flowed past Edoras on its way west towards the [[Entwash]].
Edoras was encircled by a wall, and a dike dug around the hill. It had a spring whose water flowed in a channel along the main road.
Outside, there was the [[Barrowfield]], with the tombs of the [[Kings of Rohan
column2: Rulers of Rohan]] arrayed in two lines by the [[War of the Ring]]. [[Simbelmynë]] grew there. A rutted road led from the city past Snowbourn.
